intro: Trigonosciadium tuberosum subsp. undulatum, commonly known as the wavy tuberous morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant produces edible tubers that are often used in local cuisines. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and horticultural collections.
